899e5dfb-ea6f-4162-9ba9-e0602008a3a9.content: {Knowledge claims are context-dependent}, {Standards for justification vary across different contexts}, {Doubt and certainty are assessed based on context-sensitive standards}

8b104a46-821e-47ae-ae80-63fe16717aa4.summary: Knowledge as Justified True Belief with Sensitivity
8b104a46-821e-47ae-ae80-63fe16717aa4.content: {For a person to know a proposition, it is necessary that they believe the proposition}, {For a person to know a proposition, it is necessary that they have justification for believing the proposition}, {For a person to know a proposition, it is necessary for the proposition to be true}, {A belief counts as knowledge if it is sensitive to changes in truth conditions}

8136230a-b6d4-484c-8e94-8e494fd0f700.content: {Knowledge is evaluated based on practical outcomes}, {Justified beliefs are those that reliably lead to successful action}, {Doubt is mitigated by the efficacy of knowledge claims in practical contexts}

a2097a13-3e3b-4377-91a6-a6e5167e53d4.content: {Knowledge depends on the reliability of the process that produces the belief}, {Justified beliefs are those formed by reliable cognitive processes}, {True belief generated through reliable means can constitute knowledge}

2636e53d-7dfd-4f46-84fb-ab90aa6f4f24.content: {Knowledge is a result of intellectual virtue}, {Beliefs are justified if they are formed through virtuous reasoning}, {Doubt is mitigated by the exercise of intellectual virtues}

9cce6386-65eb-422f-a7fe-e67a7fd771cf.content: {Beliefs are justified if they cohere with a system of interconnected beliefs}, {Knowledge does not rely on foundational beliefs}, {Doubt is managed through the coherence of an entire belief system}

f4cad20f-37e8-42b1-a91f-fc3ae730b688.content: {Some beliefs are non-inferentially justified}, {Beliefs can be based on foundational beliefs that are not absolutely certain}, {Knowledge is built on a network of both foundational and inferential beliefs}

c7d4d722-7ef5-4ceb-a32a-03367377ac4e.content: {Knowledge does not require absolute certainty}, {Beliefs can be justified through strong evidence even if not conclusively proven}, {Partial justification is sufficient for calling a belief knowledge}

596d1c37-011b-486d-8a9b-50dddc5855f0.content: {The standards for knowledge depend on the context of the inquiry}, {In everyday contexts, weaker justification may suffice for knowledge}, {In more rigorous contexts, stronger justification is required for knowledge}

1dcab820-dfa0-4c8e-8a21-9ca1f19b91aa.content: {Beliefs can be considered knowledge if they are useful and function effectively in practical situations}, {Complete certainty is not necessary for a belief to be justified as knowledge}, {Justification is judged by the belief's success in achieving practical aims}

45053210-27a4-408c-9ba5-f06e8ecff68f.content: {Knowledge consists of beliefs produced by reliable cognitive processes}, {Justification is a function of the belief-forming process's reliability}, {A belief can be knowledge even with incomplete evidence if formed reliably}

e6a219bf-e1dc-499c-8288-c7574d83628e.content: {Knowledge depends on the context in which it is considered}, {In certain contexts, practical concerns justify accepting beliefs as knowledge}, {Beliefs can be justifiably acted upon without absolute certainty of truth}

87df37f1-423d-4e2d-98a6-e27fc1f0a220.content: {Beliefs can constitute knowledge even if fallible}, {Absolute certainty is not required for a belief to be knowledge}, {Practical decision-making relies on sufficiently justified beliefs}

73f359f0-9a22-40eb-964c-b49206ae86fd.content: {A belief constitutes knowledge if produced by a reliable process}, {Reliability of belief-forming processes justifies beliefs as knowledge}, {Practical life can proceed based on reliable beliefs}

03559066-4dc4-49bb-94aa-dc2a9539349a.content: {Knowledge arises from cognitive virtues in the believer}, {Actively cultivating intellectual virtues leads to justified beliefs}, {Cognitively virtuous agents navigate uncertainty pragmatically}

45f42744-d6e7-4949-bff4-8f194d1af0a9.content: {Knowledge seeks empirical adequacy rather than absolute truth}, {Beliefs are justified as part of empirically adequate theories}, {Scientific practice is guided by empirical adequacy for decision-making}

d9170900-2dac-40f0-b44f-15a87d556fc9.content: {Ordinary beliefs about the world are typically true}, {Common sense beliefs provide a default foundation for knowledge}, {Pragmatic decision-making often relies on common sense as known}

99dbeec9-4672-49f9-b1a7-aa413f4b55e5.content: {Justification for beliefs arises from coherence with a system of beliefs}, {A coherent web of beliefs provides adequate justification}, {Practical reasoning uses coherent belief systems for guidance}

b299d717-7bd0-4629-b3c5-ffc761358cb1.content: {Some basic beliefs are self-justified and foundational}, {Basic beliefs provide a starting point for other justified beliefs}, {Practical actions rely on these basic beliefs without skepticism}

6078fedb-ad5e-431f-8a00-d52418a4920d.content: {Knowledge involves direct conscious experience of phenomena}, {Experiential evidence provides immediate justification for beliefs}, {Practical decisions stem from phenomenologically validated beliefs}

1ace8269-49ab-4da7-94d9-62241a042d22.content: {Knowledge attribution varies with context-sensitive standards}, {Standards for knowledge depend on practical contexts}, {Important decisions rely on contextual standards of knowledge}

d8dc8e8e-b967-4b0d-bdf4-07e618a0800f.content: {For a belief to constitute knowledge, it is necessary that it belongs to a coherent system of beliefs}, {A coherent system of beliefs provides mutual support and justification for its individual beliefs}, {The coherence of a belief system reduces doubt in the individual beliefs within the system}, {Beliefs that are part of a coherent whole can be considered candidates for knowledge}

dac91398-d21b-4e2a-95e7-6daf80483154.content: {Knowledge requires beliefs to be part of a rationally coherent network}, {Rational coherence involves logical consistency among beliefs}, {Each belief within a rationally coherent network is justified by its connection to other beliefs}, {Reasoned coherence enhances the epistemic status of beliefs, potentially elevating them to knowledge}
